docs.text: Introduction ObbySystem is a module that makes obbys easier to create for beginenrs and non-scripters Creating a Kill Brick is as simple as: local Obby = require(game:GetService("ReplicatedStorage"):WaitForChild("Obby")) Obby:killOnTouch(script.Parent) To get started, go here: Installation
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: ObbySystem is a module that makes obbys easier to create for beginenrs and non-scripters Creating a Kill Brick is as simple as: local Obby = require(game:GetService("ReplicatedStorage"):WaitForChild("Obby")) Obby:killOnTouch(script.Parent) To get started, go here: Installation
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: Functions :killOnTouch killOnTouch takes 1 argument. This argument is the part which will kill the player when touched. Example: local Obby = require(game:GetService("ReplicatedStorage"):WaitForChild("Obby")) Obby:killOnTouch(script.Parent) :icyPart icyPart makes a part icy. This argument is the part which will be icy. Example: local Obby = require(game:GetService("ReplicatedStorage"):WaitForChild("Obby")) Obby:icyPart(script.Parent) :damagePlayer damagePlayer removes the specified amount of health from the player. This function takes two arguments: the part that will be affected, and the amount of health that will be removed from the player. local Obby = require(game:GetService("ReplicatedStorage"):WaitForChild("Obby")) Obby:damagePlayer(script.Parent, 1) :disapearingPart disapearingPart makes the specified part disapear. This function takes two arguments: the part that will disapear, and the delay. local Obby = require(game:GetService("ReplicatedStorage"):WaitForChild("Obby")) Obby:disapearingPart(script.Parent) :fadePart fadePart is the same as disappearingPart with a fade. local Obby = require(game:GetService("ReplicatedStorage"):WaitForChild("Obby")) Obby:disapearingPart(script.Parent)
docs.title: Functions

docs.text: killOnTouch takes 1 argument. This argument is the part which will kill the player when touched. Example: local Obby = require(game:GetService("ReplicatedStorage"):WaitForChild("Obby")) Obby:killOnTouch(script.Parent)
docs.title: :killOnTouch

docs.text: icyPart makes a part icy. This argument is the part which will be icy. Example: local Obby = require(game:GetService("ReplicatedStorage"):WaitForChild("Obby")) Obby:icyPart(script.Parent)
docs.title: :icyPart

docs.text: damagePlayer removes the specified amount of health from the player. This function takes two arguments: the part that will be affected, and the amount of health that will be removed from the player. local Obby = require(game:GetService("ReplicatedStorage"):WaitForChild("Obby")) Obby:damagePlayer(script.Parent, 1)
docs.title: :damagePlayer

docs.text: disapearingPart makes the specified part disapear. This function takes two arguments: the part that will disapear, and the delay. local Obby = require(game:GetService("ReplicatedStorage"):WaitForChild("Obby")) Obby:disapearingPart(script.Parent)
docs.title: :disapearingPart

docs.text: fadePart is the same as disappearingPart with a fade. local Obby = require(game:GetService("ReplicatedStorage"):WaitForChild("Obby")) Obby:disapearingPart(script.Parent)
docs.title: :fadePart

docs.text: Installation Method 1 - Download Model Go to the Releases Tab Download the latest release Insert into your game Method 2 - With Rojo Install & Setup Rojo Fork the Repository Clone into your local repository Run rojo serve
